H0.text: Sunlight is the source of energy produced by plants.

H1.text: Groundwater is the source of the energy produced by plants.

H2.text: Animals are the source of the energy produced by plants.

H3.text: Evaporation is the source of the energy produced by plants.

A4.text: Plants convert light energy — typically from sunlight — into the chemical energy necessary to fuel their metabolism.

A5.text: Photosynthetic organisms store the converted chemical energy within the bonds of intracellular organic compounds (complex compounds containing carbon), typically carbohydrates like sugars (mainly glucose, fructose and sucrose), starches, phytoglycogen and cellulose.
